department_name: San Mateo County Environmental Health Services

grading_system.description: Color-coded placard system (Green/Yellow/Red) based on CDC risk factors, plus numerical scoring from 0-100 with point deductions for violations

Green.description: Pass - No more than one major violation corrected during inspection

Yellow.description: Conditional Pass - Two or more major violations corrected during inspection

Red.description: Closure - Major violations pose imminent health hazard

inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Conditional pass (yellow placard) may require reinspection within 3 business days; closure (red placard) requires correction and reinspection
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Placards must be posted in clear view of customers; inspection reports available online; approximately 50% compliance with posting requirements

fire_safety_authority.department_name: San Mateo County Fire Department - Fire Marshal's Office
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Semi-annual inspections required every 6 months per NFPA standards
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CRFC), Division 104, Part 7 of CA Health and Safety Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level inspections conducted by San Mateo County Environmental Health Services
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Food facility permits and fees approved by County Board of Supervisors; placard posting requirements; plan check requirements for new/remodeled facilities

confidence_notes: Verified information from official San Mateo County health department documents and websites. Color-coded placard system and numerical scoring system confirmed. Risk-based inspection frequency verified. Fire safety inspection requirements confirmed from county fire department sources.
verification_notes: All key information verified from official county sources. The hybrid grading system uses both color-coded placards (Green/Yellow/Red) based on CDC critical risk factors and numerical scores (0-100) with point deductions for violations (Major: 8 points, Moderate: 3 points, Minor: 2 points).
